creator: wim.torfs3@pandora.be
text:
I do the following steps:

httpd-2.0.54# ./configure --enable-mods-shared=all
httpd-2.0.54# make

and the error message is the following:

exports.c:115:2: #endif without #if
make[2]: *** [eports.lo] Error1
make[2]: Leaving directory '<localdir>/httpd-2.0.54/server'

I checked the file server/exports.c 
and if you remove the #endif at line 115, then apache will complete its compilation.

Please run;

  rm server/exports.c server/export_files
  make -C server exports.lo

and attach the generated files server/exports.c, server/export_files, and
include the output of the make command.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
Created attachment 15838
the generated exports.c file
creator: wim.torfs3@pandora.be

text:
Created attachment 15840
the log of: make -C server exports.lo
creator: wim.torfs3@pandora.be
jlh@gmx.ch
text:
Both, 2.0.54 and 2.0.55 have this problem for me.  Then I remembered that gawk-
3.1.4 (which I had on my system) has already caused heavy troubles while 
building other packages in the past.  Back in that time it was the newest 
version, but now I upgraded to gawk-3.1.5 and after deleting 'exports.c' it got 
properly generated and all went fine.

Hope this helps.
